overview_metadata.overview_title: Second Verse, Same as the First
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students use models to make sense of applying the Distributive Property with multiplication and division and then rewrite algebraic expressions. They use the Distributive Property to factor expressions so that the coefficient of the variable is one. Students write algebraic expressions based on different perspectives in real-world situations.

overview_item_data_items: I can identify when expressions are equivalent.
I can rewrite algebraic expressions using the Distributive Property.

The Distributive Property states that if <math><mi>a</mi></math>, <math><mi>b</mi></math>, and <math><mi>c</mi></math> are any real numbers, then <math><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></math>.

You can also apply the Distributive Property with subtraction and division expressions: <math><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></math> and <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>c</mi></mfrac></math> and <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>c</mi></mfrac></math>.
You can use the Distributive Property to factor an expression not only when the terms have a common factor but also to rewrite an algebraic expression so that the variableâ€™s coefficient is 1.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students develop an understanding of algebraic expressions by using visual models.
Students use models to make sense of the Distributive Property with division.
Students use the Distributive Property to rewrite algebraic expressions.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Writing Algebraic Expressions from a Situation
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students write algebraic expressions based on different perspectives from a situation.
Students write algebraic expressions to demonstrate why a number trick works.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
